verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph <WH623>. The mighty <WH410> God <WH430>, even the LORD <WH3068>, hath spoken <WH1696>, and called <WH7121> the earth <WH776> from the rising <WH4217> of the sun <WH8121> unto the going down <WH3996> thereof. of: or, for Asaph
Out of Zion <WH6726>, the perfection <WH4359> of beauty <WH3308>, God <WH430> hath shined <WH3313>.

Our God <WH430> shall come <WH935>, and shall not keep silence <WH2790>: a fire <WH784> shall devour <WH398> before <WH6440> him, and it shall be very <WH3966> tempestuous <WH8175> round about <WH5439> him.
He shall call <WH7121> to the heavens <WH8064> from above <WH5920>, and to the earth <WH776>, that he may judge <WH1777> his people <WH5971>.
Gather <WH622> my saints <WH2623> together unto me; those that have made <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with me by sacrifice <WH2077>.
And the heavens <WH8064> shall declare <WH5046> his righteousness <WH6664>: for God <WH430> is judge <WH8199> himself. Selah <WH5542>.
Hear <WH8085>, O my people <WH5971>, and I will speak <WH1696>; O Israel <WH3478>, and I will testify <WH5749> against thee: I am God <WH430>, even thy God <WH430>.
I will not reprove <WH3198> thee for thy sacrifices <WH2077> or thy burnt offerings <WH5930>, to have been continually <WH8548> before me.
I will take <WH3947> no bullock <WH6499> out of thy house <WH1004>, nor he goats <WH6260> out of thy folds <WH4356>.
For every beast <WH2416> of the forest <WH3293> is mine, and the cattle <WH929> upon a thousand <WH505> hills <WH2042>.
I know <WH3045> all the fowls <WH5775> of the mountains <WH2022>: and the wild beasts <WH2123> of the field <WH7704> are mine <WH5978>. mine: Heb. with me
If I were hungry <WH7456>, I would not tell <WH559> thee: for the world <WH8398> is mine, and the fulness <WH4393> thereof.
Will I eat <WH398> the flesh <WH1320> of bulls <WH47>, or drink <WH8354> the blood <WH1818> of goats <WH6260>?
Offer <WH2076> unto God <WH430> thanksgiving <WH8426>; and pay <WH7999> thy vows <WH5088> unto the most High <WH5945>:
And call <WH7121> upon me in the day <WH3117> of trouble <WH6869>: I will deliver <WH2502> thee, and thou shalt glorify <WH3513> me.
But unto the wicked <WH7563> God <WH430> saith <WH559>, What hast thou to do to declare <WH5608> my statutes <WH2706>, or that thou shouldest take <WH5375> my covenant <WH1285> in thy mouth <WH6310>?
Seeing thou hatest <WH8130> instruction <WH4148>, and castest <WH7993> my words <WH1697> behind <WH310> thee.
When thou sawest <WH7200> a thief <WH1590>, then thou consentedst <WH7521> with him, and hast been partaker <WH2506> with adulterers <WH5003>. hast: Heb. thy portion was with
Thou givest <WH7971> thy mouth <WH6310> to evil <WH7451>, and thy tongue <WH3956> frameth <WH6775> deceit <WH4820>. givest: Heb. sendest
Thou sittest <WH3427> and speakest <WH1696> against thy brother <WH251>; thou <WH5414> slanderest <WH1848> thine own mother's <WH517> son <WH1121>.

These things hast thou done <WH6213>, and I kept silence <WH2790>; thou thoughtest <WH1819> that I was altogether <WH1961> such an one as thyself: but I will reprove <WH3198> thee, and set them in order <WH6186> before thine eyes <WH5869>.
Now consider <WH995> this, ye that forget <WH7911> God <WH433>, lest I tear you in pieces <WH2963>, and there be none to deliver <WH5337>.

Whoso offereth <WH2076> praise <WH8426> glorifieth <WH3513> me: and to him that ordereth <WH7760> his conversation <WH1870> aright will I shew <WH7200> the salvation <WH3468> of God <WH430>. that: Heb. that disposeth his way
